summary: Richard N. Billings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list Billings as an employee. These documents provide information about his employment dates, position, and salary within the SCAS during different periods in 1978. Specifically, he is listed in payroll certifications for April and August 1978, and a certification report for December 1978.
significance: Richard N. Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents suggest he was a staff member involved in the investigation, though the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these particular documents. His presence on the payroll indicates his contribution to the committee's work.
